prompt: Can you recommend software for live call subtitles in the same language and a separate translation line?

hidden_queries: software live call subtitles same language and separate translation line live captions translation
best live captioning and translation tools for video calls software real time captions with translation
metadata.generated_search_query: software live call subtitles same language and separate translation line live captions translation

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are solid software/tools that can give you live call subtitles (same language) plus a separate translated line in real time. I’ve focused on tools that actually support both functions — not just native captions. 1) Interprefy AI-powered live captions (original language) + live translated subtitles in 80+ languages. Works with Zoom, Teams, Google Meet, Webex by inviting an Interprefy “Agent” into the call. Enterprise-grade accuracy and real-time performance. Interprefy
2) Wordly Real-time AI captions, translation, transcripts and summaries for meetings and events. Designed for multilingual environments (meetings + livestreams). Wordly
3) Akkadu AI live captions and translation compatible with any platform (Zoom, Teams, WhatsApp, etc.). Broad language support and universal integration. akkadu.ai
4) Boostlingo AI Pro Real-time captioning + live translation in 100+ languages. Intended for meetings, events, and global communication workflows. Boostlingo

sources.title: 7 Best Tools for Multilingual Real-Time Translation in Video Calls
sources.snippet: Microsoft Teams, when integrated with Microsoft Translator, offers live captions and subtitles in over 70 languages. It supports real-time speech and text translation, making multilingual conversations smoother.

citation_mappings.claim_text: 5) JotMe / Wordly / Kudo (3rd-party AI meeting assistants) JotMe: Live AI meeting assistant with transcripts + translations. Kudo: Supports human interpreters + automated captions. Wordly: Real-time translated captions for calls and events. These services are built to handle both real-time transcription (same language) and translated subtitle layers. Fora Soft+1

sources.title: 7 Best Tools for Multilingual Real-Time Translation in Video Calls
sources.snippet: Microsoft Teams, when integrated with Microsoft Translator, offers live captions and subtitles in over 70 languages. It supports real-time speech and text translation, making multilingual conversations smoother.

citation_mappings.claim_text: 6) Microsoft Teams with Translator If you’re in Teams, you can enable live captions and live translation into another language — useful if you want both on a call without separate software. Fora Soft

sources.title: Live Subtitles – Bilingual Captions & Speech Translator
sources.snippet: Live Subtitles is an automatic real-time subtitle generator that converts any audio or video into text and live translation. The app instantly transcribes speech and displays bilingual subtitles, showing both the original language and the translated text at the same time. Subtitles appear as a floating overlay on top of any app — videos, calls, live streams, social media, podcasts, online ...

citation_mappings.claim_text: Less direct but useful These don’t inherently show both lines in the call UI, but can be adapted: Live Subtitles (Windows overlay app) – floating captions with translation over any call. (can show both original and translation) Microsoft Store
Maestra AI – browser-based captions + translation options (may need layout scripting for two lines). Maestra AI
